text: Clay Aiken (born November 30, 1978) is an American singer-songwriter, author and activist. Aiken was born and raised in Raleigh, North Carolina. He was a contestant on the second season of American Idol in 2003. He is openly gay. In 2014, Aiken announced his intentions to run for congress in North Carolina's 2nd congressional district against Republican incumbent Renee Ellmers.http://thinkprogress.org/lgbt/2014/02/05/3251621/clay-aiken-renee- ellmers/ He officially filed to run on February 27, 2014. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== * Measure of a Man (2003) * Merry Christmas with Love (2004) * A Thousand Different Ways (2006) * On My Way Here (2008) * Tried and True (2010) * Steadfast (2012) ===EPs=== * All Is Well (2006) ===Compilations=== * The Very Best of Clay Aiken (2009) * A Thousand Different Ways/Measure of a Man (2010) ===DVDs=== * A Clay Aiken Christmas (2004) * Tried and True Live (2010) ==Related pages== * List of gay, lesbian or bisexual people ==References== Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:American Idol contestants Category:American LGBT politicians Category:American singer-songwriters Category:21st-century American singer- songwriters Category:American stage actors Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Politicians from Raleigh, North Carolina Category:Gay men Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT singers Category:LGBT songwriters Category:Actors from Raleigh, North Carolina Category:Writers from Raleigh, North Carolina Category:Singers from North Carolina
